runs.comm: length ball, a bit of away movement off the deck towards off stump. Shahzad lets it come on and blocks into the leg side
full, angling into off stump, gets forward to defend towards mid-off

dropped. It was fullish on off stump, but Shahzad was expecting it this time, premeditated to open up at the hips and use his wrists to whip that away, gets a lot of power on it and it carries a long way towards deep square leg, where the fielder has to dive to his right and backwards - he's a few feet in front of the rope - and he gets both hands to it but spills it. Chibhabha is the fielder.
short, very wide, too wide for Shahzad to put bat on it even though he chases it away from his body
slower ball outside off, lots of bottom hand on a rather crude heave through midwicket
slower ball, fullish, angling into the batsman. He doesn't pick it, and falls over while trying to work it into the leg side, hits the outside of his front pad

flat, slanting into leg stump. Shahzad backs away from the stumps to make himself hitting room, goes down on his back knee, and slog-sweeps it high and hard over deep square leg, onto the roof of the stadium
flat again, shortens his length this time. Shahzad laps to short fine leg

length ball sliding on with the angle towards off stump, makes room and stabs to short third man. And then we have the most bizarre bit of fielding in the history of everything. Ghani goes for an absolutely impossible single, and is almost at the other end when he decides to turn around. But instead of throwing to the keeper, Masakadza runs all the way to the stumps to take the bails off. By that time, Ghani has just made his ground, replays show.
back of a length, angling into the batsman, blocked into the covers
back of a length outside off, too close to cut, the ball beats his edge
fuller now, angling into middle stump, tucked to midwicket
slower ball outside off. Shahzad plants his back foot back, swings across the line, and misses
full, angling into middle stump, and Shahzad whips it away, gets it into the gap to the right of the square leg fielder
slower ball outside off, opens his bat face and dabs to third man
slower bouncer, Ghani ducks, the ball rises high enough for the umpire to signal wide
length ball angling down leg. Misses the flick and it rolls off the pad through backward square leg
short and very wide, once again too wide for Shahzad to connect with that horizontal-bat slap
slower ball, short and a long way outside off, reaches out and steers to third man
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hips towards midwicket
slow, flighted ball on middle and leg, looks for the slog sweep but doesn't time it, hits it along the ground towards wide long-on
length ball sliding with the arm. Ghani misses the flick into the leg side, and the ball hits his front pad, a long way down leg, though
back of a length on the pads, worked away through backward square leg
length ball on middle stump, and Ghani hits a monster six, clears his front leg and clubs it a long way over midwicket
short this time, hurries through a bit quicker than Ghani expects as he looks to pull, doesn't quite time it and it rolls down slowly towards deep square leg
fullish, angling down leg. Shahzad makes a bit of swinging room and absolutely batters it, swinging across the line and landing it somewhere on the road beyond the square leg boundary
down the track first ball, what a greeting. He bowls it right in his slot, up there on off stump, and he frees his arms and smacks it back over the bowler, one bounces and over the boundary
full, angling down leg, clipped away to deep square leg

bam. They're all looking to follow Shahzad as he moves away from leg stump, and they keep bowling it into his hitting arc. It's full, and he plays the most nonchalant pick-up shot and clears the midwicket boundary
slower ball, short, angling into the batsman, pulled to deep midwicket
short slower ball down the leg side, terrible delivery considering that fine leg is in the circle, but Ghani manages to hit his pull straight at that fielder
another slower bouncer, this one climbs a bit higher, and Ghani plays a controlled hook out to deep square leg
short ball on off stump, and Ghani is a little early on that pull, he's through his shot and it hits the top edge, or maybe the back of his bat and rolls away to the third man boundary
shortish, angling into the batsman and cramping him for room. Dabbed towards short third man
slower ball wide of off stump and Shahzad skips across and opens his bat face to try and steer it past short third man but the fielder stops it with a dive to his left
slower ball on off stump, and that's a super shot, makes a bit of room and gets down on one knee with his weight leaning back, and cuts it away to the point boundary
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
short, sits up on off stump, and he rocks back quickly and pulls fiercely, and Waller has to chase a long way to his left from deep square leg and put in a dive to cut it off at the rope
flighted legbreak wide of off and Ghani misses the slog-sweep
tossed up full on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
bowled him! Held it back a bit, both in terms of pace and in terms of length, and Shahzad is through that big sweep too early and the ball crashes into middle stump
flighted ball on leg stump, blocked to midwicket
nice change of pace, a bit slower, looks to sweep and misses. Hits him on the pad outside leg
tossed up slow on off and middle, blocked back to the bowler
slower ball on off stump, back of a length, flat-batted back to the bowler
short ball outside off, pulled to the left of deep midwicket, and Raza tumbles athletically to his left to field it
back of a length, angling into leg stump and cramping Ghani, who was moving away from leg stump to make room. Punched quietly down the ground to long-on
full on middle stump, clipped through wide mid-on
slower ball wide of off, driven down to long-off
back of a length outside off, quick single after Stanikzai plays a back-foot poke almost straight at the short extra cover fielder
tossed up nice and high and Stanikzai gets too close to the pitch as he jumps down the track, jabs it back to the bowler
down the track again and this time he's in a good position, enough swinging room against the wide-ish, flighted ball, and he slogs it away over wide long-on
and it's a short sighting. Shorter this time from Cremer and he pulls, doesn't quite connect as cleanly as he would like, and Raza takes a good catch diving to his left at deep midwicket
tossed up, drops on a good length on middle and leg and turns away, lets it come on and dabs it towards backward point
googly turning down leg, Sadiq presses half-forward to defend and doesn't pick it. Hits him on the top of the pad
quicker ball close to off stump, goes back and dabs towards short third man
shortish outside off, stabbed away to third man

back of a length, a touch too straight, and that's a lovely shot, lets it come on and uses his wrists to tuck it away off his hips, to the left of the short fine leg fielder, and it races away to the boundary
length ball on middle and off, gets forward to poke it past the bowler diving to his right in his follow through
length ball angling into middle and leg, defended into the on side
length ball on off stump and he shuffles across and scoops over his shoulder, doesn't quite middle it - in fact it went off his left glove - and it rolls away into the fine leg region
full on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
fired in on the pads, misses the flick and Raza has a polite lbw appeal turned down as it hits him on the pad, clearly outside leg
length ball outside leg, no pace on it, heaves at it and drags it a short distance away into the square leg region
flighted outside off, driven to the right of sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, and that is a super slog-sweep, all along the ground, powerful, drills it into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
short outside off, chopped to backward point
fullish outside off, opens his bat face and looks to steer past backward point but the fielder stops it, diving to his left
down the track and he shortens his length a bit, fires it in quicker outside leg. Sadiq only gets pad to it as he stretches out to defend
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away into the midwicket region
shortish, angling down leg, looks to swipe it away and can only get some pad on it, rolls down towards short fine leg
loopy on leg stump and Sadiq makes a lot of room and drives inside-out, cleanly, up and over the leaping cover fielder
length ball on off stump, swept towards deep square leg
short, goes with the angle down the leg side, and Ghani misses the pull
shortish outside off, cuts crisply but straight to backward point
down the track and Raza slows it down, shortens his length a bit on middle and leg and Sadiq is too quick with his flick, the ball hits him on the pad
tossed up wide of off, Sadiq goes for the big drive and misses
flatter on off stump and Sadiq frees his arms to launch that over the bowler's head, clean and firm
full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket

loopy flight wide of off and Ghani has to make all the power himself, Raza had slowed it down considerably. Hit it hard, looking to hit straight down the ground, but only managed to pick out the fielder at long-off
length ball outside leg, tucked away to the left of short fine leg
length ball on middle and leg, looks to punch down the ground but Cremer dives to his left and cuts it off
length ball on off stump, and Sadiq has picked out deep midwicket. Plays a powerful slog-sweep, clearing his front leg, and Chibhabha takes a good low catch, diving forward
tossed up outside off, it's the googly, he looks for the flat-bat drive and it beats his inside edge
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to whip it down to long-on

not quite short enough to cut and it slides on with the angle to deny him room. Chops down off the bottom edge and it smashes the edge of Mutumbami's glove on its way down, and he's in a lot of pain. Looks like one of his fingers took a nasty hit
length ball sliding down leg, Nabi misses the flick and it hits him on the pad
length ball on the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg
fullish outside off, driven to the left of short cover
flighted ball wide of off stump and that's plenty of swinging room for Naib, gets down low and smashes it back down the ground, over the non-striker, and it easily clears the rope
very full now, jabbed back to the bowler, almost out of the blockhole
quick and flat on leg stump, swept firmly to deep midwicket
shot. That was tossed up, right in the slot for Nabi, on off stump, and he opens up at the shoulders, hits through the line, and clears long-on with ease
starts the over with a short ball outside off and he sits deep on the back foot and clubs it away powerfully between long-on and deep midwicket
length ball wide of off stump, goes after it and misses. Wasn't quite pitched up for the big drive
fuller now, comes forward and drives into the covers
low full-toss outside off, driven to long-off
sees him making room and fires it full outside off. Nabi swings and misses
full outside off, flat-batted to long-off
fullish ball wide of off stump and Gulbadin smashes that down the ground. Uses his reach and swings freely to hit it back over the bowler's head and clear the boundary with ease
full outside off, too full to get any elevation, and he drives hard but all along the ground and straight to long-off
full-toss on middle stump, swivels at the hips and clubs it over the leg side. Doesn't time it well and it bounces down towards the onrushing deep midwicket fielder
slower length ball angling across Gulbadin. Looks to swat that into the leg side, going against the angle, doesn't make contact

full and wide, this time it's too wide for Gulbadin to be able to hit down the ground, and the angle is against him too. Slices it towards third man and he's fortunate it doesn't carry all the way to the fielder
short and wide and that is asking to be punished. Just stood there and slapped it hard over cover point
full-toss outside off, slapped straight to cover
looks to bowl wide and full, and ends up bowling too wide outside off
tossed up slower on off stump, swiped down to long-on
another full-toss, and Nabi clears his front leg and smacks that over the extra cover boundary
and another. This one's short and wide, and Nabi times it so well, slaps it up and over the covers
full-toss on off stump, this time it's angling into the batsman and he looks to clear his front leg and go over the on side, ends up finding Raza coming in from the long-on boundary
flighted ball wide of off stump, slices his drive up and over point
back of a length outside off, dabbed away through point
yikes. They're so worried about his ability to strike it down the ground that they've consistently looked to bowl wide of off stump to him, only he overdid it considerably this time
shortish outside off, and he's chopped it on. That came on slower than he expected as he looked to pull, only managed a bottom edge onto the stumps
slower bouncer angling into the batsman, and Ashraf waits and pulls it towards short fine leg
full outside off, not as wide as he wanted, and Gulbadin can clear his front leg, free his arms, and flat-bat it hard over the bowler's head. Such a crisp hitter down the ground
slower bouncer angling across, and he doesn't quite time his swivel as he shapes to pull. Can't connect, and it rolls down to the keeper

wow. Was looking to move across his stumps and maybe target the fine leg region. Jongwe saw that, and fired it even wider outside off. Gulbadin somehow reached out, sliced under it, and hit it hard enough to clear the third man boundary

slower ball outside off, and Gulbadin is run out. Ashraf looked to slog across the line, and it bounced through to the keeper. They looked to sneak a bye, and Mutumbami's underarm throw is pinpoint accurate
slower ball wide of off stump, Rashid swings and misses, looking to carve it over the off side
another slower ball, a bit of offcut taking it towards off stump. Rashid slogs across the line, and bottom-edges past his leg stump, down to the fine leg boundary
down the track, gets inside the line of a full ball angling into him, chips it over extra cover
slower ball outside off, and this one is short enough for Rashid to wait on the back foot and swivel through the hips to smash that over deep midwicket
full and wide and Rashid carves it over point, slows down as it bounces to the left of the sweeper cover fielder
